intro: Myriolimon ferulaceum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has a fibrous root system that helps it survive in dry conditions, and its leaves are typically narrow and succulent. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Myriolimon ferulaceum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various desert organisms.
